A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It was certainly an entertaining way to spend 2.5 hours. It was extremely well-polished\, was aesthetically stimulating\, but overall I thought it was terrible. It feels all too disconnected from the Star Wars universe everyone knows. Felt like I was not watching a Star Wars film\, but a Disney sci-fi space movie. Roam Johnson could have used the setups and mystery from episode VII but it was no well connected at all. I personally think this is my least favorite of the entire series; didn’t answer any questions the audience had\, plot was lazy\, writing was not strong.
